definition: to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: But Mother stood and watched the driver while he carried the boxes into the house.
sentences.chinese: 但是赶车人把箱子搬到房子里去时妈妈站着看着他。

sentences.english: Does not he drive for Squire Make-a-stir?
sentences.chinese: 不就是替一个有权有势的乡绅赶车吗？

sentences.english: Alpatitch went back to the house, and calling the coachman told him to set off.
sentences.chinese: 阿尔帕特奇回到屋里，叫了车夫，吩咐他赶车上路。

sentences.english: I drove on, remembering the lean, hungry face of the sleeping man.
sentences.chinese: 的赶车人瘦削而带有饥色的脸仍在脑子里盘旋。

sentences.english: Once he saw several drivers boiling pink flowers.
sentences.chinese: 有一次，他看见有几个赶车的人正在熬煮粉红色的花。

sentences.english: Then he drove straight on to the little temple of Jupiter that overlooked the town.
sentences.chinese: 于是他就赶车直向俯视整个城镇的朱庇特小庙走去。

definition: to hasten on with one's journey/to hurry on
to take the car, bus, train etc
person in charge of pack animals/chariot driver
to harness (a horse to a cart)
to pull a carriage (of draft animal)
